intro: Eriocaulon lasiolepis, commonly known as the woolly spikerush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like appearance with slender, cylindrical stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded areas, such as marshes and swampy soils. Its leaves are usually short and covered with a fine, hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Eriocaulon lasiolepis plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and is often found in subtropical and tropical regions.
